Issues.Title: Add an option to disallow concrete root providers to be used in TestBed
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

Currently, `TestBed` will happily use any `providedIn: 'root'` dependencies, in addition to dependencies provided by the component under test, or in non-standalone applications, module providers. This makes it extremely easy to introduce concrete dependencies to the test environment and thus break unit test isolation.

### Proposed solution

Add an option to `TestBed.configureTestingModule` that removes root, component, and module providers from consideration. This will force developers to provide mocks (or at least consciously choose concrete implementations) for all dependencies of a component.

Dependencies internal to the framework, such as those used by `effect` will need to be excluded from this restriction as framework functionality does not need to be mocked.

### Alternatives considered

Another approach would be to add a validation method that no concrete user services have been injected, similar to `HttpTestingController.verfiy`. I feel that putting it upfront rather than a testing assertion is more readable and harder to make a mistake with, but if the implementation of such a method is easier then it is a valid solution to the problem.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add an option to disallow concrete root providers to be used in TestBed" (#57123)

Issues.Title: docs (docs-infra): add the ability to filter API references on developer preview/experimental
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

Currently, it's not possible to get an overview of all API references marked as developer preview or experimental. 

### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem

https://angular.dev/api

### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation

_No response_

### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem

_No response_

### Describe what you want to experience that would fix the problem

It would be great if we could filter the API references based on `status` and not just show/hide `deprecated` items. With the functionality added in https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/57062 we could also directly link to a list of these items, e.g. https://angular.dev/api?status=developerpreview. These direct links can also be added to https://angular.dev/reference/releases#developer-preview and https://angular.dev/reference/releases#experimental (related https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/55336)

### Add a screenshot if that helps illustrate the problem

_No response_

### If this problem caused an exception or error, please paste it here

_No response_

### If the problem is browser-specific, please specify the device, OS, browser, and version

_No response_

### Provide any additional information here in as much as detail as you can


The current UI was created when `isDeveloperPreview` and `isExperimental` were not yet available in the underlying manifest.json.

My current idea would be to replace the `deprecated` toggle with a button dropdown with the following options: `all (=default) | stable | deprecated | developer preview | experimental`. This would change the current behavior of initially hiding `deprecated` references and show all references on the overview page still with an indicator for the `deprecated` references.

Looking for opinions on this, since it would change the current behavior of displaying API references.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs (docs-infra): add the ability to filter API references on developer preview/experimental" (#57119)

Issues.Title: Revert "fix(router): Scroller should scroll as soon as change detecti…
Issues.Body:
…on completes (#55105)"

This reverts commit 66ffeca2dea1eed5f88a81d8ef167da87796f3f8.

It looks like nuxt encountered the same issue with scrolling when waiting for Vue's `nextTick`, which is a microtask. This would have similar timing to ZoneJS's rendering in the microtask queue. This reverts to a `setTimeout` alone, though recreates the problem in #53985. This was also mentioned in one of the comments in the Nuxt issue and the solution would be `rAF`.

In order to address #53985, we'd likely want to use the `race(rAF, setTimeout)` that we use in the zoneless and coalescing schedulers. This would have effectively the same timing as the `afterNextRender` implementation here with zoneless, but quite different timing to `afterNextRender` with ZoneJS.

fixes #57109
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Revert "fix(router): Scroller should scroll as soon as change detecti…" (#57115)

Issues.Title: Add a merge function to be able to merge two signals into one output
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

@angular/core

### Description

I want to be able to merge two signals into one stream similar to the rxjs merge function. 
The context for us is to merge input and output signals into one stream. We can't use the model signal since in certain instances we might want to do things when the input changes and not the output. (If there is a way to separate the two it would be nice to know, but I think the request is still useful)

### Proposed solution

I managed to create a workaround using rxjs interop:
```typescript
function mergeSignals<GValue>(...signals: Signal<GValue>[]): Signal<GValue> {
  return toSignal(merge(...signals.map(s => toObservable(s))), {initialValue: null as GValue});
}
```
https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-iqyqix?file=src%2Fmain.ts

### Alternatives considered

A better solution would be to handle internally since I assume it would be more efficient. I don't know enough about the internal structure at this point to suggest something better.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add a merge function to be able to merge two signals into one output" (#57112)

Issues.Title: Skipping hydration on i18n nodes breaks hydration
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? core ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When enabling hydration + i18n support, adding `i18n` to elements that have hydration skipped breaks hydration on the client side due to missing root nodes. The actual error thrown varies based on where the `skipHydration` attribute and `i18n` nodes are: **Attributes on the same component:** ```html Text ``` throws `ERROR Error: ASSERTION ERROR: Expected root i18n node during hydration [Expected=> null != null <=Actual]` **ngSkipHydration attribute on the parent of an i18n node:** ```html
Text
 ``` throws `TypeError: rootNode is null` **ngSkipHydration hostbound attribute on the parent of an i18n node:** (ie. `app-unhydrated-text` has `@HostBinding('attr.ngSkipHydration')`) ```html
Title!
 ``` throws `NG0502: During hydration Angular was unable to locate a node using the "firstChild" path, starting from the … node.` The only combination that works is applying `i18n` outside the area that's skipped: ```html
Text
``` This only applies to `i18n` nodes in the same template as the elements which have hydration skipped. `i18n` nodes deeper into the tree are also fine (ie. here, `app-has-i18n` has i18n tags in its template) ```html ``` ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://github.com/henry-alakazhang/angular-i18n-skiphydration-repro ### Please provide the exception or error you saw _No response_ ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 18.1.1 Node: 18.20.3 Package Manager: yarn 1.22.19 OS: darwin arm64 Angular: 18.1.1 ... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic ... platform-server, router, ssr Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1801.1 @angular-devkit/build-angular 18.1.1 @angular-devkit/core 18.1.1 @angular-devkit/schematics 18.1.1 @schematics/angular 18.1.1 rxjs 7.8.1 typescript 5.5.4 zone.js 0.14.8 ``` ### Anything else? I fiddled a bit with the code and adding an `if (isInSkipHydrationBlock())` guard inside `prepareprepareI18nBlockForHydrationImpl` in `hydration/i18n.ts` stops the issue from happening (and the page seems to render / hydrate correctly). Don't have the context of the conventions/though to know whether that's the right solution and/or would have any side effects

Issues.Title: Switch schematics to common import manager
Issues.Body:
Includes the following changes which allow us to delete one import manager implementation in favor of a common one.

### refactor(compiler-cli): add alias option to the import manager
Updates the import manager to allow for a specific alias to be passed in. This is a prerequisite for switching schematics to the new import manager.

Note that passing in an alias disables identifier conflict resolution in order to avoid rewriting the alias that was passed in explicitly. For now this is fine since we have a very narrow use case for it, but we may want to revisit it in the future.

### refactor(compiler-cli): import manager not picking up some options
Fixes that the `ImportManager` wasn't picking up some of its configuration options.

### refactor(migrations): use common import manager for schematics 
Updates the schematics to reuse the common `ImportManager`, instead of having to maintain a separate one.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Switch schematics to common import manager" (#57096)

Issues.Title: feat(forms): add support for pushing an array of controls to formarray
Issues.Body:
Enables users to add an array of FormControls to a FormArray using its existing .push() method, instead of pushing each new FormControl one by one triggering events along the way.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [X] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [X] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [X] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
`FormArray` `.push()` currently only accepts a single `FormControl` or `FormGroup`, manipulating a `FormArray` holding large datasets and using expensive validators is complicated by this behavior, as there is no easy way to refresh the dataset without breaking existing streams depending on its `.valueChanges`.

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
`FormArray` `.push()` now accepts both a single `FormControl` or `FormGroup`, but also accepts an array of the same types. In case of an array, it will register all controls as expected and emit a single event after.


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [X] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information
Ran into this issue myself working at a client, where we could not easily manipulate a `FormArray` where we want to refresh a large dataset. Swapping it out for a `new FormArray()` seemed like the way, but this broke any existing streams subscribed to its original `.valueChanges`, making it difficult to keep everything in sync and reactive. 

This solution at least makes it possible to manipulate a dataset within a `FormArray` as a new dataset, instead of having to iterate over all new controls. A possible expansion on this solution, and to promote immutability, could be to offer an additional method that also internally clears the existing dataset so a full replace would be possible.

Additionally, managed to run the entire test suite locally, except for `//packages/zone.js/test:karma_jasmine_test_ci_chromium` which seemed to not be able to connect to its ChromeHeadless browser and therefore fail. Hopefully the CI can run this test for me, but I'd still like to know what went wrong exactly. Short excerpt:

```
...
//packages/zone.js/test:test_node_error_lazy_policy             (cached) PASSED in 0.9s
//packages/zone.js/test:test_npm_package                        (cached) PASSED in 0.7s
//packages/zone.js/test/zone-spec/clock-tests:test_patched      (cached) PASSED in 0.5s
//packages/zone.js/test/zone-spec/clock-tests:test_unpatched    (cached) PASSED in 0.4s
//packages/zone.js/test:karma_jasmine_test_ci_chromium                   FAILED in 541.3s
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(forms): add support for pushing an array of controls to formarray" (#57102)

Issues.Title: Form groups initialized in FormBuilder can't be initially disabled
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

forms

### Description

Currently to disable a formgroup. You first initialize it and then call group.disable()

```
this.group= this.fb.group({
  "firstName": [''],
  "middleName": [{value: '', disabled: true}, Validators.required],
  "lastName": ['']
});
this.group.disable(); // not ideal
```

You've made a beautiful, nearly feature complete declarative API.
I mean, Ideally the input to formbuilder would be fully serializable with an intermediary layer for insantiating validators, but that's not in scope for this issue.

****

### Proposed solution

Add disabled? boolean to new interface FormGroupOptions extends AbstractControlOptions

```
this.group = this.fb.group({
  "firstName": [''],
  "middleName": [{value: '', disabled: true}, Validators.required],
  "lastName": ['']
}, {disabled: true}); // nice! the API is fully declarative
```

### Alternatives considered

It can be done progamatically, as can everything the formbuilder does.
You could also return the formgroup on methods like disable() so that it's a chainable operation
```
this.fb.group({}).addValidators([]).disable();
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form groups initialized in FormBuilder can't be initially disabled" (#57101)

Issues.Title: Extended diagnostics do not run on structural directive attributes
Issues.Body:
This came up while I was working on #57033. The visitor that is meant to visit every expression in a template currently skips over the `templateAttrs` ([see](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/4ac39aeea988bd423795bac70d480620f49f2267/packages/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/typecheck/extended/api/api.ts#L189)). This is incorrect, because the `templateAttrs` don't get copied over into the element node for something like `
`. As a result, our current extended diagnostics haven't been checking the expressions of structural directives. In #57033 I tried fixing it, but there were a lot of failures even for the trial run so I expect a lot more for a global one. As a workaround in #57033, I've added a flag that allows the problematic diagnostics to retain their old behavior, but eventually we should remove the `canVisitStructuralAttributes` flag and resolve the failures.

Issues.Title: Path[1] argument must be of type string. Received undefined
Issues.Body:
### Command

extract-i18n

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I have been trying to export the i18n information from a part of our code, previously this code was in our project as components.
Now I want to create a library out of it and the actual building and using it in the project as a package works but when exporting with `ng extract-i18n --project <projectNameHere>` I keep getting the error from the title: 

> An unhandled exception occurred: The "paths[1]" argument must be of type string. Received undefined

In debugging the offending line and file I've found that the actual object used in this process has the `path` variable but it's an object.

Changing this to an array or just a string does not resolve the issue and even breaks the actual build of the library.

I've reproduced this in a brand new project and still the same error.

### Minimal Reproduction

Create a new workspace, add a library and try to extract localization info

- ng new company.Angular.Components --no-create-application
- cd .\company.Angular.Components\  
- ng generate library @company/angular-lib-forms 
- ng add @angular/localize
- ng extract-i18n --project @company/angular-lib-forms

    at async execute (C:\Users\<username>\Desktop\Projects\<projectname>\node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\builders\extract-i18n\builder.js:84:28)
```

Issues.Title: ng-elements(runtime exception): build-angular:application + optimization: true
Issues.Body: ### Command build / core / zone.js ### Description Hey! I'm (with my team) in the process of migrating a huge enterprise micro frontend based app to the new esbuild build stack. But, I'm facing some runtime issues that I'm not really able to flag as "internal problems" or "angular issues". So: either I'm doing something really stupid (then sorry for the waste of time) or there is a bug at angular level. At the moment, I'm mostly inclined to think it's an angular issue related to the usage of "ng-modules" / "zone.js" and the way esbuild is striping the bundle from unnecessary code as soon as `optimization: true` (default). To reproduce the issue, I've created a simple angular project ([myws](https://github.com/mauriziocescon/myws/tree/master)) that you can fork and play with. It's a tiny and simplified version of what we're doing in our CI/CD. Here is a summary of the process: - build an ng-element (with ng-modules / zone.js) as an application, - concatenate the resulting files in one main.js, - load such files at runtime. As you can see in the repo, the results are the following: - mf1 (✅): built with `"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser"`, `"buildOptimizer": true`, - mf2 (✅): built with `"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:application"`, `"optimization": false`, - mf3 (🚫): built with `"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:application"`, `"optimization": true`. where mf1 / mf2 / mf3 have basically the same code. The runtime error for mf3 is not really helpful: Locally, I get different errors for different internal mfs, but I assume the root cause is the same. Some examples: I hope there's enough information to the make the ticket actionable on your side! Otherwise, feel free to request whatever makes more sense for you. Thanks a lot! ### Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/mauriziocescon/myws/tree/master ### Your Environment ```text 18.1.1 ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ng-elements(runtime exception): build-angular:application + optimization: true" (#28101)

Issues.Title: Angular 18.1.1  is not adding CSP nonce attribute to script tags generated during build(main.ts,polyfills.js etc...)
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I want to implement strict CSP policy for my project, so replaced unsafe-eval and unsafe-inline with nonce-dynamicnonce.
But Angular version 18.1.1 is not adding nonce to script tags of main.js, polyfills.js etc. 
Because of that it is considering this scripts tags as unsafe and browser is blocking its execution.
In below stackblitz I used 18.1.1 and added nonce using CSP_NONCE and ngCspNonce. But it is not adding nonce to script tags. Please inspect and check in Dom.
Stackblitz URL: https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-wr9a9h?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.config.ts


As per below merged Issue, It should work in 18.1.1. But it is not working.
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/27875

Kindly check!!
Thanks in advanced!

### Minimal Reproduction

1) apply nonce using ngCspNonce and CSP_NONCE provider
2) using dev tools check script tags  in DOM.
3) It is not adding nonce to script tags of main.js,polyfills.js etc..

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
18.1.1
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: BUILD: Changes to local repo's build system(path to npm_package_archive.tgz files)
Issues.Body:
Fixes the paths to npm_package_archive.tgz on local builds

## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

<!-- Please check all that apply using "x". -->

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [x] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?
I have followed the documentation steps mentioned in [Developer.md](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/docs/DEVELOPER.md). After running `yarn build --local` the package.json file for every scope(i.e. cli, build, pwa, etc..) have incorrect paths to npm_package_archive.tgz

Steps to reproduce
1. Clone the [angular cli repository](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli). 
2. Run `yarn build --local`
3. Open the dist folder and extract _angular_cli.tgz (Using this as an example you can look for any other tgz file in dist)
4. Open the `package.json` file
5. Look for `@angular-devkit/architect` (Using this as an example)
6. You will observe that the path to the file is something like: `<path>\packages\angular_devkit\npm_package_archive.tgz`
7. The same thing can be observerd in many places in this package.json file, and in other package.json files of other generated `<package>.tgz`



<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: N/A

## What is the new behavior?

Expected path(using `@angular-devkit/architect` as an example) should be `<path>/packages\angular_devkit\architect\npm_package_archive.tgz` 

<!-- Please describe the new behavior that. -->

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [ ] No
- [x] Maybe(As it is chaning the package.json files for local builds)

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

## Other information

The problem seems to be in `link_package_json_to_tarballs.bzl` file where an unnecessary `dirname ` in line 56 is used ( this is resulting in `parent of parent dir` instead of just having `parent dir`). It is executing a statement like `(  dirname (<path>\packages\angular_devkit\architect)    )/npm_package_archive.tgz` which is resulting in TAR to have an incorrect value like `<path>\packages\angular_devkit\npm_package_archive.tgz`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "BUILD: Changes to local repo's build system(path to npm_package_archive.tgz files)" (#28100)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/compare/v2.7.8...v2.7.9)

#### Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6:

1.  Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2.  Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_bazel_lib", version = "2.7.9")
```

> Read more about bzlmod: <https://blog.aspect.dev/bzlmod>

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE` file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_bazel_lib",
    sha256 = "c780120ab99a4ca9daac69911eb06434b297214743ee7e0a1f1298353ef686db",
    strip_prefix = "bazel-lib-2.7.9",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/releases/download/v2.7.9/bazel-lib-v2.7.9.tar.gz",
)

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies", "aspect_bazel_lib_register_toolchains")

### Required bazel-lib dependencies

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()

### Register bazel-lib toolchains

aspect_bazel_lib_register_toolchains()

```

#### What's Changed

-   perf: reduce concatenation in relative_path by [@​jbedard](https://togithub.com/jbedard) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/pull/868](https://togithub.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/pull/868)
-   chore: upgrade to Aspect Workflows 5.10.6 by [@​gregmagolan](https://togithub.com/gregmagolan) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/pull/876](https://togithub.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/pull/876)
-   fix(tar): expose package_dir argument in mtree_mutate by [@​gzm0](https://togithub.com/gzm0) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/pull/873](https://togithub.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/pull/873)
-   fix(tar): append slash to top-level directory mtree entries by [@​sin-ack](https://togithub.com/sin-ack) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/pull/852](https://togithub.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/pull/852)

#### New Contributors

-   [@​sin-ack](https://togithub.com/sin-ack) made their first contribution in [https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/pull/852](https://togithub.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/pull/852)

Issues.Title: sass `UrlRebasingImporter` rewrites urls in inline assets
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

18.0.2

### Description

Given these styles files:
```scss
// app.component.scss
@use './foo.css';

// foo.css
.x{background:url("data:image/svg+xml") 0 0 no-repeat,url("data:image/svg+xml;clip-path='url(%23a)'") 0 0 no-repeat;}
```

`ng build` throws this error:
```log
❯ ng build
Application bundle generation failed. [2.303 seconds]

✘ [ERROR] expected ")".
  ╷
1 │ .x{background:url("data:image/svg+xml") 0 0 no-repeat,url("data:image/svg+xml;clip-path='url("||file:%23a")'") 0 0 no-repeat;}
  │                                                                                               ^
  ╵
  src/app/part-of-adyen.css 1:95  @use
  src/app/app.component.scss 1:1  root stylesheet [plugin angular-sass]
```



### Minimal Reproduction

https://github.com/sod/issue-css
```sh
git clone git@github.com:sod/issue-css.git
cd issue-css
yarn
ng build
```

You can also try the original css where I distilled the css from:
![CleanShot 2024-07-19 at 15 08 43@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1de0fd51-3810-492b-95b3-e5824bdcd3d5)

### Your Environment

```text
     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / △ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/


Angular CLI: 18.1.1
Node: 20.11.1
Package Manager: yarn 1.22.19
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 18.1.1
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1801.1
@angular-devkit/build-angular   18.1.1
@angular-devkit/core            18.1.1
@angular-devkit/schematics      18.1.1
@schematics/angular             18.1.1
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.5.3
zone.js                         0.14.8
```

---

Downgrading to angular 18.0.2 fixes the issue:

```sh
yarn set version berry
yarn config set nodeLinker node-modules
yarn
yarn up '@angular/*@18.0.2' '@angular-devkit/*@18.0.2' 'typescript@5.4'
ng build
```

![CleanShot 2024-07-19 at 15 22 49@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3f1b69bc-692f-4ee4-ab3c-1111e85fa7b3)

Upgrading to 18.0.3 lets it reappear:
```sh
yarn up '@angular/*@18.0.3' '@angular-devkit/*@18.0.3' 'typescript@5.4' && ng build
```
![CleanShot 2024-07-19 at 15 23 39@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/208802cc-7daa-48c4-9055-cb2820b29916)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): correctly detect comma in Sass URL lexer
Issues.Body:
The Sass rebasing lexer was incorrectly checking for a comma in certain cases previously. This has now been corrected and url usage that immediately follows a comma within a rule will now be extracted as expected.

Closes #28084

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): account for HTML base HREF for dev-server externals
Issues.Body:
When adjusting URLs to support explicit external dependencies when using Vite, the workaround will now account for the presence of a base HREF value within the specifier. Vite will automatically add the base HREF as a prefix to the path when specified. This previously resulted in invalid specifiers due to the partial removal of the Vite specific `@id` path prefix.

(cherry picked from commit 37a2138cb474778ef398a8d4129e1c389dde0f44)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/build): account for HTML base HREF for dev-server externals" (#28085)

Issues.Title: Explicit externals not working in the Vite Dev Server when BaseHref is set
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

18.0

### Description

External dependencies set in angular.json used to be rewritten to /@id/dependency when running the dev server prior to Angular 18.1.

Since version 18.1 the /@id/ part of the dependency was removed from external dependencies, which is helpful but doesn't take in account that vite will rewrite urls to match the BaseHref option and removes any trailing slash added to the BaseHref.

### Minimal Reproduction

- Create a new application with `ng new`
- Install any package with npm and use it in the AppComponent
- The package to "externalDependencies" in angular.json (ex: `eruda`)
- Add a baseHref with a trailing slash to angular.json (ex: `/test/`)
- Run ng serve and notice that Angular has failed to load due to vite trying to load `/testeruda` and failing

Issues.Title: Build fails on impossible Typescript error with RxJS
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

The Angular cli refuses to build a project with error "TS2345: Argument of type ... is not assignable to parameter of type ...", even though Typescript itself is able to correctly deduce that no type issue is occurring. This issue occurs with RxJS.

### Minimal Reproduction

In the code below, null values for `id` are filtered out of the pipe, so that the type of `id` inside the map function is only `number`. Typescript correctly produces no error (at least for me, using vs code). Nonetheless, the Angular build still fails, thinking that `id` is still of a nullable type.

```
  myFunction(): void {
    const objectWithNullableProperty: {id: number | null } = {id: 243};

    of(objectWithNullableProperty).pipe(
      map(obj => obj.id),
      filter(id => id != null),
      map(id => this.doSomethingWithId(id))
    ).subscribe();
  }

  doSomethingWithId(id: number): void {
    console.log(id);
  }
```

### Exception or Error

```text
Build fails with error:

TS2345: Argument of type 'number | null' is not assignable to parameter of type 'number'.
  Type 'null' is not assignable to type 'number'.
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 18.1.0

Thank you in advance for your help!

Issues.Title: build: docs incorrectly outputting function parameters with object literal type
Issues.Body:
We were extracting the type of a function parameter by splitting on `:` and taking the second item. The problem is that if the type is an object literal, it'll have more than one colon in its text.

These changes fix the issue by only looking for the first colon and extracting the name based on it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: docs incorrectly outputting function parameters with object literal type" (#29471)

Issues.Title: fix(material/form-field): hiding a label after it has been shown leaves a blank space
Issues.Body:
There is a method _shouldLabelFloat that determines if the label should float. A check was added `_hasFloatingLabel` to see if a floating label exists before deciding whether the label should float. Examples were added at the end of the input-demo file, where you can see inputs without labels (both fixed and dynamic). Removing the solution also allows you to simulate the described error. Unit tests were added to validate the solution.

Fixes #29401
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/form-field): hiding a label after it has been shown leaves a blank space" (#29461)

Issues.Title: feat(material/tooltip): replicate tooltipClass to default MatTooltipDefaultOptions
Issues.Body:
The `tooltipClass` property has been added to the default configuration options in `MatTooltipDefaultOptions`. This new property is optional and supports the same syntax as `ngClass`, just like the component's default attribute. As with some existing configurations, if a CSS class is defined directly on the tooltip component, it will automatically override the default class. An example has been added to the `tooltip-demo` file. Additionally, two tests have been created to ensure the solution works as expected.

Fixes #29355
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(material/tooltip): replicate tooltipClass to default MatTooltipDefaultOptions" (#29467)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-form-field): 'cols' attribute of <textarea> does not work with mat-form-field
Issues.Body:
### Description

When using <mat-form-field> to wrap a <textarea>, setting a value for 'cols' attribute does not change the width of the <textarea>. This caused some consistency issues since the 'rows' attribute (which is used to set the height of <textarea>) still working as intended. 

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: [StackBlitz Example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-cvhgfz?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html)
Steps to reproduce:
1.  wrap <textarea> with mat-form-field 
2.  change cols attribute value


### Expected Behavior

The visible width of the <textarea> should be set according to the value of 'cols'.

### Actual Behavior

Modifying 'cols' attribute value does not have any effect on the width of the <textarea>. 

### Environment

- Angular: ^18.0.0
- CDK/Material: ^18.0.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome 126.0.6478.128 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 11
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-form-field): 'cols' attribute of <textarea> does not work with mat-form-field" (#29459)

Issues.Title: Option selected and on change callback is called before the animation completes
Issues.Body:
Created a subscription for the auto complete event, this ensures the animation is firstly closed before calling the optionSelect and onChangeCallBack
NB: due to this change there is one unit test that is failing because we are no longer making the selected value dirty immediately but doing it via the subscription

#29326
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Option selected and on change callback is called before the animation completes" (#29458)

Issues.Title: feat(mat/checkbox): add new aria properties to MatCheckbox
Issues.Body:
Added three new aria properties to MatCheckbox:

`aria-expanded`: Indicates whether the checkbox controls the visibility of another element. This should be a boolean value (true or false). `aria-controls`: Specifies the ID of the element that the checkbox controls. `aria-owns`: Specifies the ID of the element that the checkbox visually owns. These attributes will be added to the generated checkbox element if they are specified, and won't be present in the HTML if not provided. Also added a small paragraph at the end of the checkbox.md file.

Fixes #28761
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(mat/checkbox): add new aria properties to MatCheckbox" (#29457)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/scrolling): support multiple items per row
Issues.Body:
Add virtual scroll support to multiple columns per row. The viewport will list items with flex-wrap styles, and the width of each item has two types of values: fixed pixel and percentage. For example, {width: 200, height: 50} and {width: '25%', height: 50}.

Fixes #10114
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/scrolling): support multiple items per row" (#29453)

Issues.Title: fix(material/chips): increase chip remove touch target size
Issues.Body:
Fixes Angular Components Chips component accessibility issue where the touch target is too small. Updates the chips' remove button ::after margin and padding styles to create a larger touch target to meet the minimum 48px x 48px size.

[Before screenshot](https://screenshot.googleplex.com/LY4J6jk4b3TFyQo)
[After screenshot](https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7Nwr6gzbWkwBwum)

Fixes b/286959517
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/chips): increase chip remove touch target size" (#29452)
